metadata.Title: CVE-2015-5237 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description: protobuf allows remote authenticated attackers to cause a heap-based buffer overflow.

notes.Note: seth-arnold> since the message parsing limit defaults to 64 megabytes a software author would have to change the limit in order to handle larger messages anyway, and is thus unlikely to generate these messages in the short-term. (There is no actual limit on generation, so this might be an issue today -- it is just not a priority for the maintainer.) mdeslaur> per upstream bug, this was fixed in 3.4.0

criterions.comment: protobuf: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was deferred').
